description: Been coming to this place for years and its a good spot in the neighborhood to get coffee. The coffee is strong and the family that runs the place is super nice. There are other breakfast type foods available (ex: sandwiches, bagels, muffins, cookies) but I usually just stop by for coffee. It's not the swankiest or nicest looking place but it doesn't pretend to be anything that it's not.
author: Al D.

description:
Came here first time on a Sunday early afternoon. This is post is mainly for the staff sweeping at the patio, who is very rude. 
I sat on the chair at the patio using my phone, before entering the cafe.  The staff came out with a broom, and started sweeping right next to my feet. He did not say a word. (I heard him speak English so it's not a language barrier). I stood up, and moved away from the chair, so that he can sweep. I had expected an "excuse me", or "May you move so I can clean this area, etc.", but he said nothing. Then, he continued sweeping for about 5 minutes, while I kept moving away so that he doesnt' bump into me. Then, the staff looks at me like I should leave the patio, or go somewhere else. 
That's very poor customer service! Any guests on the patio is a potential customer! Should not treat a customer like they should leave so that you can clean! And because of this behavior, my friend and I decided to dine somewhere else.
author: Jess W.

description: Don't get me wrong, I do really like this little lovely cafe! Nice little neighborhood cafe around corner in obviously over priced union street. But, could you please be a little bit more careful about the hair drop in my English muffin? Much appreciated;)
author: Queenie X.

description:
I LOVE going up to San Fran.  I have probably been going since I was knee high to a grass hopper.  As I have gotten older I have learned that SF is known for all the restaurants, shopping and theater.  I like to call it a mini NY because you have all the quaint little shops and grocers in the neighborhoods along with different mom and pop restaurants.  I LOVE the personal touch of going to family own business'.

This place was right down the street from our apt. We saw it the first day and was drawn in by the massive BEAN ROASTING MACHINE they have inside.  Yes they actually roast their own beans before brewing them!  Talk about fresh!

We didn't think they had food, food unless you wanted to eat some fruit or a pastry so we waited and came back later.  We ended up stopping by on our way out of town.  They have coffee from ALL OVER the world and I do mean all over!  HUGE bags of coffee beans in their natural form.  It's GREAT!

We ordered two coffees and found out they do have some hot breakfast foods in the form of bagel sands and ritos.  We each got a rito, paid and went to find a seat.  They have a nice sized seating area or you can eat on the little steps where there is one table looking out onto the street.

They gave us our cups with coffee and we went over to doctor it up.  The coffee was SUPER HOT and FRESH!  I think I burned my tongue.  But it's a small price to pay for fresh hot coffee.  They brought our ritos to our table.  NICE and hot.  They didn't take too long to make I'm guess that they are premade and froze then heated up.  

Everything was really good and a NICE way to start the day before heading out to the airport.  It was also GREAT because we could call for our Uber and it picked us up right in front of the coffee shop.  No extra walking.
author: Ryan P.

description:
Place was cozy and quite, old school vibes.

Customer service was really quick and friendly.

My Vanilla Latte came out just the way I like it.

No complaints, 5 stars it is.
author: Yuriy T.

description:
4 stars just because this is an SF coffee place that 1) isn't pretentious and 2) isn't Starbucks.  I believe it's family run, and is a bit run-down in an endearing way.

Coffee is decent.  Espresso drinks are hit or miss depending on who's at the bar that day.  They have a variety of sweeteners and spices set out for coffee.  

They have a surprisingly good selection of food, both healthy and unhealthy.   They have typical coffee shop baked goods (bagel, croissants, danishes, scones, coconut macaroons, biscotti, cookies), as well as breakfast burritos and sandwiches, fruit cups and whole bananas, single boiled eggs and a variety of energy bars.  Drinks include Vitamin Water, Odwalla Juice and Kombucha.  

Good amount of seating and nice people watching on Union Street.  Generally not crowded.
author: Holly P.

description: Nothing to rave about here except the location. Ordered an iced chai tea latte. Super "spicy". Along with a cranberry oat cake. Lacked major flavor, but consistency was nice and chewy. They do have outdoor seating and not a big crowd on Sunday morning, so didn't wait long at all.
author: Amanda M.

description: They 3 " because 3 is good & that is exactly what USCR SF is ""you have to have them warm up the breakfast burritos  & the egg mic-muffins "" obviously freshly made earlier in the AM & quite tasty quality strong coffee that gets executed quickly.
author: Sean K.

description: This place had decent coffee and it's a great location. It could be amazing if they invested some money to improve the decor and offer better breakfast options (they heat up the sandwiches in the microwave?!) I think they need a good interior designer and brand manager and this place would beat all the other coffee shops in the hood.
author: Lady N.

description:
This place is a joke. I understand that places have credit card minimums; in this case it is $3. I went and got a hot tea that rang up to be $2.35. I gave them my card and they looked at me like I was on crack. In broken English, I was told I needed a debit card, which I didn't have.

After the rude treatment, I offered to round up my purchase to $3 in the spirit of giving gratuity and they said they didn't want to do that, even after the tea had been made. I've never been completely turned down at the counter of a business where I want to give them revenue before.

I ended up storming out while rolling my eyes. This was not an experience I really wanted to have today... thanks a lot Coffee Roastery.
author: Meaghan H.

description:
Great place to stop in for a cup of coffee - I was able to get a cortado and a breakfast burrito for $9.50.  The service was friendly and incredibly prompt (I waited less than a minute for my coffee, and about 1.5 min for my burrito).

While I was more of a "grab and go" customer, there's ample seating to stop for coffee.  It wasn't too loud either!

I'm excited to bring some of their bean home to make in my French press!
author: Colin P.

description:
We were having dinner later nearby and had an hour to kill. We wanted a break from drinking so we decided to drop by Union Street Coffee Roastery for some caffeine. Stopped by on Friday, September 2nd at 7pm.

I ended up getting a Double espresso ($2.95). I love my espresso super strong, so this was rather weak. There wasn't much of that rich, slightly bitter flavor I love. And the consistency wasn't much thicker than that of regular coffee. I basically drank it as if it were just a cup of coffee.

The coffee shop was pretty much empty when we got there, so we just grabbed a table inside. They also have seating outside which would be great on a nice day. Good for people watching. It was rather chilly out, so we opted to sit inside.

Cute low key coffee shop. I only wish their espresso wasn't so weak.
author: Elena N.

description: Really cute place. I didn't eat but the food looked really good. Coffee was perfect and service was friendly.
author: Lianne G.

description:
First the good--nice location, lots of seating. 

Then the less good--the coffee isn't up to the level of the newer shops around town, and the decor is very tired by now. 

Not terrible but you can do much better without much effort.
author: JM H.

description:
Nice atmosphere and friendly employees
Quality of the food needs to improve though 
Bought a croissant that was so old and stale I could barely bite into it
author: George G.

description: Had an oatmeal raisin cookie, definitely one of the better ones I've had. Can't speak about anything else on their menu though.
author: Chris W.

description:
Friendly neighborhood gem with delicious, affordable options. Love that they always have vegan options for breakfast and don't charge you to use soy, almond and coconut milk. Also, they have coconut milk 

Also a plus that you can sit inside and work or sit outside and people watch, there's plenty of space.
author: Katie B.

description: I got a very good cappuccino with friendly service. The place looks nice, with a relaxed atmosphere, and the seating is comfortable. No complaints from me. It's a great place to meet up with someone (which is what I'm doing).
author: re s.

description:
Bought a coffee and Bagel. I have my Contigo mug fir coffee and was charged the large price a 50 cent difference, but I have my mug which saves them $$ on cups. I asked for the manager "but he/she was not in". I explained to the cashier how unfair to be charged for a cup that they kept, and that I usually get charged the price of a small because I have my own mug. His reply was I just work here, easiest cop out, as he gave me a look that expressed; I don't care and haha you paid already.

Coffee and Bagels are great, but as a person who drives people for a living I am taking them off my list of recommendations.
author: A D.

description: This place is a dumpster. The coffee tastes strait up bad (over roasted, over brewed, etc). The food isn't fresh. On the plus side there always seems to be seating available. I wonder why.
author: Mark S.

description:
The service here was horrible. Unorganized line with the barista making drinks for anyone calling stuff out, regardless if they're in the back of the line.

Therefore everyone's drink order was out of sync.

And speaking of drinking coffee, it was just plain old. I ordered a plain cup of coffee and a latte for my brother and they both tasted like they had been sitting there for hours.

And forget about adding cream to the coffee. When I tried to pour it, it looked chunky and just plain curdled. So gross.

Expensive and crappy coffee.
author: Jack R.

description:
Grabbed an iced coffee here on Monday July 5.  It was tasty and refreshing!
If I'm in the area again, and I'm bound to be, I'll stop in again!
author: Stephanie V.

description: Great coffee and very friendly employees. I go there 3 or 4 times per work week and will continue to. Thanks, Rolando and team.
author: Kendall Austin S.

description: Another typical neighborhood café that serves up coffee and snacks. Although it offers slightly less room to sit that its Chestnut Street counterpart, it does have a panoramic view of passersby and street action on its particular corner of Union. The coffee, food, and the rest of the experience are simply average.
author: Vincent L.

description:
They have barrels and barrels of coffee in the house. We walked in and noticed they offer a coffee of the day selection. The selection was... French Roast!!! Soooooooo, y'all have like 47 different coffee options and that's the best you can do?? Child!!!!!!

We needed caffeine in a pinch and this place happened to find us. That's it and that's all.
author: Hector G.

description: I don't know why the stars are so low right now, the service is really great here and the snacks are yummy! Had the spinach quiche and almond iced latte
author: Melissa W.

description:
This is the best coffee I have had in SF by a local roaster and coffee shop! It's not a hipster or fashionable place, but if you like good service and are a stickler for good, fresh coffee then this is your spot! 

Love them, love their show!
author: Shannon V.

description:
I love this place! Great coffee, good food, AMAZING STAFF. These folks will take care of you! They have patience to be able to put up with the typical Marina crowd(sense of entitlement attitude, old $, frat boys, etc). They always have a smile on their faces, which in turn makes me smile. So Much better than that big corporate coffee chain!

5 stars
2 thumbs Way up
A++
author: Melody C.

description: I really love the convenience of Union Street Coffee Roastery as I used to live right around the corner. The staff is super friendly and the coffee is pretty moderately priced in comparison to the location. There's also tons of seating both inside and a few tables outside. Also, if you're catching the 41 or 45 at the Union/Fillmore stop and need to grab a coffee it's the perfect location!
author: Teresa C.

description: Very friendly staff, good coffee, low price for the location, clean and lots of seating.
author: Ilona G.

description: Nice iced coffee. Nice location, but this place isn't really conducive to a true hang-out coffee shop like the true old Roastery's that I know. The coffee isn't fresh and the quality of the espresso drinks is poor to average
author: Kevin F.

description: Excellent coffee and a friendly staff.  The perfect stop while shopping on Union Street.
author: Ronda J.

description:
Sub par coffee and terrible service.  The only redeeming asset to this coffee shop is their location. 
My co-workers and I go this shop often enough since it's a corner coffee shop so close to the bus stop and it's open by 7am.. 

This morning though, I bought a banana and I changed my mind buying an odwalla smoothie.  I was so embarrassed when the cashier looked at me, rolled his eyes and told me (rather loudly) "i don't like doing this!"  Meaning he doesn't like/doesn't know how to delete items from his register. Sorry, but I changed my mind! People still do that, right?  Yes, it's a little annoying (I'm in retail services too) but I wouldn't ever be so bold rolling my eyes and telling a customer off like that.  While leaving, A woman from the line even asked me if I was ok. 

An hour later a co-worker walked in to work telling me that the guy at the coffee shop asked her if she knew an " Asian girl with with the last name David" at work.  Wow! This guy really asked about me to talk trash to my co-worker?!! 
I have NEVER had to deal with anyone so rude and unprofessional in the food services this way.  

Management should really consider the people working for them. I think your have to be semi a morning person to serve coffee in the morning as to not dampen people's first human interaction.
author: Melanie D.

description: $3.00 minimum on credit cards.  I'd rather go to Peet's where there is no minimum on credit cards.  Fumbling around with loose change and dollar bills for a cup of coffee?  Last time I checked it was 2015, not 1986.
author: David G.

description:
Okay...not sure where to begin about Coffee Roastery. Here's the deal- it is consistent with quick service and a great location (right outside the bus stop on a lively corner). The associates are very friendly and quick to help. However, I have to say (and I've had others agree...) the coffee is HORRIBLE! The beans are BURNT beyond recognition and you can tell just by walking in the place that they over-roast the coffee. You spend 5 minutes in there and you smell like you've been roasting beans yourself for weeks. I'd much prefer a cup at Starbucks or even Peets (which, side note tastes like mud). They also don't have a good selection of pastries or anything...it's honestly all sub par. But either way...I keep going back! Cheers to Coffee Roastery! 

PS- $5 minimum for credit cards
author: Ashley S.

description:
Decent coffee. I guess I keep coming back because of the location. It's pretty damn convenient. 

My croissant was pretty lackluster. Just tasted like buttery bread. Yes, I know smart alack, croissants ARE buttery bread. But, it was bland. It's 7:30 am, they're already stale??

Three stars is right for this coffee spot.
author: Dusty B.

description:
It's a great vibe and somewhere you may want to hang out but not sure they have the best coffee in town.

I would suggest asking for an extra shot / seems to come out a little weak!
author: Mark S.

description: The service here ruined my morning and we ended up having to go elsewhere. When there was a problem with my order, instead of validating it and trying to make up for it, they tried to convince me there was nothing wrong and the manager(?) said he had the same thing earlier and it was fine so it must be my problem. They made me feel like crap by saying "do you just want the two bucks back?" No dude, I don't need my money back, I need you to not be rude to your customers. Also their quiche sucks, you're better off getting food from the frozen section of the grocery store across the street. This place's food and drinks are old and way past their expiration date.
author: Rachel S.

description: The coffee actually wakes me up and gets me going.  The staff are friendly and the coffee is served in a couple of minutes.  I get the mocha with a shot (triple mocha.)
author: Shaun W.

description:
The coffee is not that great here, however, the staff is so sweet I keep coming back. 

The teas are amazing though, and their pastries are yummy!
author: Judie R.

description:
1. Very friendly staff
2. Amazing Coffee (had a Vanilla Latte). 
2. FAST & free wifi!
author: Molly S.

description:
I went extremely hopeful...The setup is charming and they have a grand variety which only increased my curiosity. I ended up getting the 20 ounce French Roast drip; i lasted only 5 sips....HORRIBLE! I wouldn't serve this to my worst enemy it was so bad! The service wasn't the best but it wasn't the worst. 

I ended up going to my trusty coffee spot for a cup of delicious Ethiopian :)

Needless to say I won't EVER be going back!

If you do end up going: Enter at your own risk!
author: This Is M E.

description:
I thought I would work from here one Friday...not really ideal. The coffee shop is on a street corner with a busy bus stop, so there's constant in/out traffic from passers-by. The door stays wide open, so there's a cool draft making it somewhat chilly. Again, not ideal for the typical cozy "cafe" experience. Nonetheless, I decided to make a few hours of it, and got a medium coffee to enjoy the wi-fi and people-watching scene. 

Overall, I highly suggest going elsewhere for a cafe experience and/or if you're looking for a place to work/study. The computer outlet situation is terrible. Only one extension board hangs out in the corner, which makes it accessible from a maximum of two tables. On the bright side, the wifi works well and they seem to have fixed the limited time issue.
author: Mansi A.

description: No character - it's all gone. No service - you get insincere smiles and blank looks. This used to be a morning favorite but no longer. Too bad. Where do you get a good coffee on Union these days?  Shameful
author: Why N.

description: I go here every morning before work.  Fresh roasted coffee is just SO much better than the rest.  No frills, just seriously good coffee.
author: Sage S.

description: They asked us for here or to go. We said for here but still got paper cups. When I pointed the issue they did not care a bit or even bothered answering me unil I asked 2-3 times. The answer I got was "oh yeah". I ain't ever coming back to this place nor sould you if you care about humane treatment or service.
author: Glea M.

description: This place is the best with the friendliest staff that remembers your name and treats you like family.  Great coffee and pastries and their beans are excellent as well.  Highly recommended.
author: Jake T.

description: This place is the best in the morning! They are so speedy/efficient and the coffee is sooo good!
author: Coree W.

description:
I actually haven't been to a coffee place in ages and now I remember why.  Because of places like this that have no creativity and no respect for their patrons.

My husband and I stopped in here to go to the bathroom and since it was getting cold, we decided to order some drinks.  If you've been following my previous reviews, you know that I just bought a ton of tea at David's Tea.  My husband ordered a latte, a slice of cake and since I already had tea I thought I could just get some hot water.  I asked the girl if I could just have some hot water and she paused and thought for a moment before saying, "It will be 75 cents."  ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!?  I could understand it being 75 cents if I was buying the tea too but 75 cents when their cold water was free AND they have a sink in the bathroom that spouts out both cold AND hot water?  This made no sense and her attitude didn't help.   It wasn't even listed on the menu so it seemed to me like she just made it up!

There were two girls behind the counter and one of the girls was gabbing on her cell phone the whole time.  I wasn't sure who was making our drink but when my husband came out of the bathroom (like 15 minutes later, sorry but he needed to go!) he was confused that his drink hadn't come up.  He noticed a drink on the counter and since there weren't very many people inside (gee, I wonder why?) he assumed it was his.  Which it was.  I was sitting right next to the counter and the girl didn't even call our name or let us know the drink was ready.  When he drank his latte, it was cold and it tasted like the milk had curdled.   We left the drink and cake there and left.  We didn't ask for a refund because the girl was too busy talking on her phone to pay attention to us so we called it a loss and left.

I don't drink coffee anyway but it's because of places like this that remind me why.
author: Victoria C.

description:
Went here to chill because my brother and I had to wait 45 mins to eat at Unami Burger. I ordered a double shot espresso while my brother ordered a cafe latte.

Conclusion: Don't order espresso drinks here. My bro and I shockingly looked at each other's face and said, "Our espresso and latte we make at home taste not just better, but far better". LOL! The Mexican alike Batista kid obviously had problem doing tamping, temperature surfing and steaming. The espresso was poorly pulled and the latte just didn't taste like a latte. It tasted like the one my bro and I used to make when we started learning how to make latte. My bro and I aren't professionals or anything. We are just espresso geeks who have pulled 500+ failed shots with a $1000 setup. Trust me, we know what a fail shot tastes like. Now we pull much better shots, but not as good as coffee shops like Bluebottle, Four Barrel and Brownowlcoffee. 

Hey kid if you see this, you better step up your game!

Rancho Silvia v2
Rancilio Rocky Doserless Grinder
Coffee Beans: BrownOwlCoffee Orfeu whole beans $19 a pound
author: Ka N.

description: Was strolling on Union Street with my boyfriend on a weeknight, and popped in here for a cup of coffee and to catch the rest of the Giants game. Service was friendly. My pumpkin spiced latte was yummy, great space with a bathroom and TV. It was a good find for us!
author: Siv L.

description: Just had the worst experience there! The woman behind the counter was too busy on her cell to take my coffee order. I waited she finally came over and I simply asked if the coffee was fresh. She said brewed 30 minutes and not fresh. I asked where I could get fresh coffee and she told me to go to Starbucks down the street.
author: Kathy J.

description: Got a yummy latte and a great croissant. It was very busy in there, but they were friendly and it's a pretty big place so we had a lot of room. Would definitely come back to try their other pastries.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
On Union street for my monthly Brazilian wax, I was in need for a quick bite to eat.  

I made my into Union Street Coffee Roastery looking for a sandwich.  Unfortunately, they only had some pre-made turkey and cranberry sandwiches and breakfast burritos--Not exactly what I was looking for.  They also had a variety of pies, tarts, brownies, and frozen yogurt, which all looked yummy, but since I hadn't eaten anything all day, I wasn't in the mood for sweets just yet.  

I finally saw that they had Quiches...yay! Something of substance that I could throw into my mouth quickly.  They offer a Spinach Quiche and a Ham and Cheese Quiche.  

I ordered the Ham and Cheese Quiche.  

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/FlX-HcLrnK9gzLh-BDJ7Tg?select=TI5-dJUgkkvvEryGz6zdGQ
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/FlX-HcLrnK9gzLh-BDJ7Tg?select=4Y20Jlrspomp-_U0LczUFg

Wrong choice!  The quiche was lacking in flavor in all ways possible.  The puff pastry for crust on top and on the sides was so soft, soggy and not flakey at all.  

Furthermore, I thought I ordered the Ham and Cheese Quiche, but there was BARELY any ham, and I couldn't taste the cheese. What there was an abundance of, were chopped onions.  Quiche did not taste good. It was also way too eggy.   

Needless to say, after my Quiche, I wasn't in the mood to try any of their sweets.   I was turned off.
author: Cass J.

description:
Yuck. I come in here for "emergency coffee" and always regret it but this last time takes the cake. Ordered a cappuccino and it tasted terrible and was way too hot. Asked for a toasted bagel to go and the bagel was barely toasted and they didn't even bother to put cream cheese on it- just some little cup on the side. Bagel seemed flavorless and slightly stale.

I feel like they don't care about their customers or the quality of their goods at all.
author: Sean B.

description:
Came here because it was conveniently located across from Umami burger. This is a nice looking place with a creative menu. However, the service was...awkward. I ordered an espresso. When I gave the cashier my credit card to pay for it he took the card, flipped it over and analyzed it, and then gave it back and told me that there's a $3 minimum for credit cards (darn). I didn't mind paying for my order in cash, but the fact that he took my card and looked over it and THEN told me that I couldn't pay for my order with the card was suspicious. Either he wanted to check my card out or he thought my card was fake (because it's one of those ostentatious gold capital one venture cards ugh sORRY it's not my fault I wanted flight points on my credit card). 

Anyway, the espresso itself was served to me within seconds. It tasted awful. I've had espresso from various locations in this city and each time the flavor of the blend is different, but the pattern is the same--an initial warm bitterness that fades out into the flavor of the coffee blend that is used. This was so different, and not in a good way. It was an initial liquid-y-ness (almost like drinking hot water) and it faded out into a back-throat bitterness that was terrible. My only explanation was that the espresso maker might not have been good.

Life is too short to consume bad espresso. Avoid.
author: Idk A.

description: Good coffee, friendly and very quick staff. The neighborhood is kind of douchy, but that's not their fault. I wish the hours were longer in the evening. Other than that, this is one of the few coffee houses with a local feel, left that are not too far from downtown, and haven't been eaten up by high rent.
author: Arkady I.

description: This place sold me the worst espresso beans I've ever tasted. I tried to finish the bag but I couldn't because they were so awful.
author: Kyle M.
J R.

description: The plain cup of joe is the best in town! Not bitter, not watered down...
author: Laure W.

description:
Fro-yo girl here.   I saw the new sign for Honey Hill Farms fro-yo and stopped dead in my tracks.  It's been a long time since I've had HHF.

While HHF used to be widely available in California, HHF moved from CA to Arkansas...and YoCream picked up most of the HHF accounts.  

Most HHF signs that I see are leftover from years ago and shops just haven't put them away even though they've switched to YoCream.  

Union Street Coffee Roastery has four HHF fro-yo flavors a day (all HHF) and 18 dry toppings (no fruit toppings, mostly candy, nuts, cookies, sprinkles, chocolate chips, yogurt chips and three flavors - strawberry, melon, plain -  of mochi balls).  HHF even has tart flavors now (but I recommend sticking to the sweet flavors).

Flavors of the day:
* Blueberry tart: icy texture but creamy, heavy, chalky aftertaste, didn't like it
* Vanilla bean: unlike most vanilla fro-yo, you can actually see vanilla bean flecks in this fro-yo!!!!  It's really good - thick, creamy, smooth, rich and with a strong vanilla flavor 
* Dark chocolate
* Peanut butter

Fro-yo prices:  Small ($2.75)/ Medium ($3.50)/ Large ($4.00)

The portion was generous (not Yogurt Park size generous though) and toppings were placed in the middle of the fro-yo and on top.  I had the granola which was okay though not crunchy enough.  I'm definitely coming back for more HHF.

They also have coffee and pastries (quite a few muffins) and a coffee roasting machine.  I don't know what the coffee is like.

You know you love me.  X0 X0, fro-yo girl.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Cute place - airy, bright, wooden tables and chairs all around.

Not so cute chai tea - it was bland but spicy ($3.75 for a large one - not sure if they charge extra for soy, because I FORGOT TO ASK and now I'm paying the price).

Great location (perfect for a quick coffee when I'm waiting for the bus).

Not so great breakfast burrito - pre-made and refrigerated.  Even though they heat it up for you, it's pretty bland and wouldn't be good without the hot sauce they give you.  Best breakfast burrito in town is still from Cicil's near the Embarcadero/Rincon Center.

Overall, not a bad place of you're just stopping in for a quick bite.  They have pastries (cupcakes, etc.), different types of caffeinated beverages, and refrigerated bottled drinks.
author: Tori S.

description:
Average. 
A little grungy feeling. 
Mediocre staff persons. 
Mehh--dirty chai. 
Pretty awesome cappuccino foam.
Excellent people watching outside.
author: Briana F.

description: This is not the place to go for a fresh croissant or friendly service... To be fair they do not make their own pastries and baked goods. Great neighborhood though...
author: Dominique P.

description:
I go here because it's directly across the street. I really, really wish they had a punch card because I actually come everyday! Nothing is particularly good here. The coffee isn't extraordinarily tasty and the food is actually kind-of gross. I am kind of a snob about health and nutrition and organic food makes a big difference to me. I think their burritos taste a little old. 

But i do keep coming back here and overall this place does the job. Some of the staff are really kind like the older man with grey hair. i am not particularly impressed but this is relative to all the extremely good restaurants and cafes in San Francisco... it's hard to compete. 

I'd give it 3 and 1/2 stars if 1/2 stars existed.
author: Jaqueline M.

description: The Pumpkin muffins are the best I have ever tasted! Lots of other pastries, muffins and scones. Also, check the Fairfax location is equally awesome, when out in the North Bay for a hike or biking!
author: Paul R.

description: Looks like a blend of Perkins, Baker's Square and a Wild West saloon. Wifi is great, seating is decent.  The only problem is this VERY loud refrigeration unit which even with headphones, I can't blare out the din of it.  It's probably why everyone is an in and out customer.  C'mon guys do something about it.  Good quiches and pies.
author: Eric J.

description:
I would like to know why every time I come here, they act like I'm bothering them when I step up to the counter to order something?! Um... isn't taking my order 50% of your job and making my order the other 50%?

I usually trek way down Union and go to Boulange or Starbucks for my chai, even though the Roastery is closer to where I live by a few blocks. Today, I was starving since I had stupidly forgot to eat lunch when I got caught up working on some projects. I was trying to kill time before meeting a friend. So I decided to get a chai to help quell the hunger pains and was promptly reminded why I avoid coming here even though the chai is pretty good.

First off grumpy barista. Second my chai was WAY too hot! Way beyond any drinkable temperature (the friendly baristas down the street always make your drinks within a drinkable range of temperature), and lastly, when I got to the end of my chai, there was a small twig in my cup. UGH! Perhaps it's from the bottom of the chai concentrate, but shouldn't you have noticed a twig going in the cup when you poured it in and fished it out?!

As an aside, I don't like that they started selling frozen yogurt, when the corner store across the street has been selling frozen yogurt for years. I'm boycotting the frozen yogurt as a show of solidarity.
author: Dani D.

description:
Matt came to this corner Union St. coffee house for a quick energy booster and breakfast. Normally finding parking along  the strip of Union St. is really difficult, but the morning was not a problem. There is no need to park in front of the bus-stop like some Pacific Height's residence do.

The AM line was long, but moved really quickly. Matt ordered his usual Medium size (16oz) Depth-charge and Bran Muffin. The strong $2.50 drink was very tasty and complimented well with the moist $2.50 Bran Muffin. The drink was what he needed before a workout. Although there many coffee shops on Union Street, this coffee-shop is a winner. So chalk up another good Joe spot for Matt.
author: Matt G.

description: Meh....keep walking you can do better.  The place is well located on a major shopping block, but it's sort of dirty and dang if the counter staff isn't the grumpiest ever (have some delicious coffee my friends).  The pastries are your standard shrink wrapped fare.  Might be okay in middle america, but we are in coffee heaven folks...up your game!
author: BethAnn S.

description:
Are you kidding me?   Yeah, so it's a fucking coffee roasting company on the corner of Fillmore and Union.  And?

The coffee's ok but kinda pricey.   I really hate, though, that they hide their toilet by putting an 'Employees Only' sign on the door.    You gotta do a trick and pluck like a chicken to get the keys to open the bathroom door.   Fuck that, dude... you're a business and I pay you money for coffee... Gimme the fucking bathroom key, ok?   

Also, the seating is arranged in such a way that you can conveniently give a pedicure to the patron seated next to you.... charming.  Can you please try and avoid putting toenail clippings in my coffee?
author: David O.

description: I am a coffee snob and a pastries snob and I think both are phenom here. Service is always quick and the employees are ultra-pleasant  in the mornings, and coffee is *strong*. Pumpkin muffins are divine.
author: Lauren C.

description: So-so coffee joint. Why haven't they opened a Philz or Blue Bottle type joint in this area?
author: Andrew K.

description: Good coffee, but nothing life changing. Roasted right there on location and the employees have always been friendly, even in the early hours
author: Clayton C.

description:
I come here when I'm on my way to work. I only get coffee and pastries. My favorite is the blueberry bran muffin. The staff is friendly and a couple of the baristas know me. Customer recognition is always a plus. They know I'm going to ask for some soy in my coffee after they pass it off to me. Hahaha. The condiment bar is fully stocked- simple syrup, cocoa powder, vanilla powder, honey, splenda, etc. I like that.

Good coffee, service, condiments, pastries and I here there's free wifi...I like this place.
author: danielle l.

description: Not Bad.  If I was living in any other part of the country it would be great....but I have had Blue Bottle and Four Barrel.  SF you spoil me!
author: Jordan S.

description: Friendly staff, fantastic coffee, real cups and cutlery, great people watching.
author: Lars J.

description:
I've driven by this place many times and finally decided to stop in today to do some studying. There were about 4 small round tables outside with a row of benches and the inside had about 3 rows of tables and chairs- quite roomy. 

The white mocha here is quite good. I dont like mine too sweet and I was thankful that it wasnt. They also have a variety of pastries, cold/hot drinks, cookies and froyo. Free wifi is always a plus, though I believe it's only limited to 2 hours. The staff here is also super friendly.
author: M W.

description: Unexpectedly smooth and very tasty espresso. I was impressed. Very nice roast and well prepares (machiatto foam had good consistency)
author: Zara S.

description: This is a good Coffee place. In the Marina. It has a wide selection of Coffee and snacks. Its nice location. I I think is could had a litter more of a selection of snack's but it also has a nice environment. Im alway a Fan of wifi because I'm always on the moon.
author: Jonah C.

description: I love the Union Street Coffee Roastery, because they always greet me with a friendly good morning and they always have gluten-free or sugar-free bars and snacks to try! I usually order iced coffee with the cranberry bar or the raw oat bar. It doesn't disappoint!
author: Gina R.

description: My daily stop for many years. Support your local business. They know my order automatically and have it going even when they see me across the street. The aroma of the freshly roasted coffee is a great way to start the day. And I like that the coffee bean being brewed changes on a daily basis.
author: Chris C.

description: Fast line on a crowded Sunday morning = excellent.  I had the decaf drip which was the Plantation roast that day, and it was super distinctive with a rich, earthy taste -- not your typical decaf (it was almost as good as caffinated coffee, which I can't really have, which is sad).
author: Olivia L.

description:
union street sells coffee, some pastries and froyo;  it's a pretty small place with seating for about 20 people.

froyo availability:
-vanilla bean:  very rich, creamy,
-dark chocolate
-peanut butter: very rich peanut better taste
-blueberry tart

pricing: (sm) 2.75 (m) 3.50 lg (4.00)
toppings: .75 each, 18 dry toppings available. in an enclosed case.
no fruit toppings listed.

frodrips:
-yogurt creamy , smooth,  very rich flavoring, not  sugary (by honey hill farms)
-taylor machines used
-generous servings
-very attentive service by nonstraight personel.
author: Victor G.

description: The folks who work at this coffee shop don't seem like seasoned coffee buffs, but rather a nice family who runs the business. Nonetheless, they make a good cup of joe and have great prices, lots of seating, and a clean bathroom. There is a nice selection of snacks, which include sugar-free and gluten-free which is refreshing for a small chain chain. This place is not as popular as the nearby Starbucks which makes it a great place to stop by when you don't feel like waiting in line. I prefer the frozen blended coffee drinks here over the hot drinks.
author: Cindy M.

description: Bad bad burnt coffee. Unfortunately also unfriendly and unenthusiastic staff.
author: Camilla C.

description: Good lord is that coffee strong and acidic...and the prices for baked goods are outrageous for this dinky little shop.
author: MakeUp M.

description:
They're open super early, but aren't the friendliest batch of baristas around.

The staff is very business-oriented: take your money, brew the coffee (mediocrely), and serve you.

I've been ~3 times, and they've never made an effort to make small talk or even act friendly.

Oh, and no free WIFI - Come on, this is San Francisco... the internet grows on trees here.

So, I haven't gone back. The Chestnut location of Coffee Roastery is much friendlier, reserve Union only for caffeine emergencies.
author: Blake B.

description: Very few electrical outlets for laptops. Moderate amount of noise (mostly from the buzz of the fridge.) Not a lot of seating. They have ZR-Net wifi (Uhg.). It's right next to the 22 muni stop. Alright place to work from your laptop or talk with friends, but not comfortable enough to stick around for longer than half an hour. The tv is constantly on and kind of distracting.
author: Al S.

description: Great coffee, very friendly service, and a nice place to people watch.
author: James V.

description:
I like this joint. :) It's just really laid back and consistently has good drinks. It is also a good place to pick up a wedge of quiche or a bagel. It's also really convenient, seeing as how it's right in front of a bus stop.

Times visited: a *lot*
author: Amy L.

description: I love their mocha, it's the only place where I think it's perfect!  Not too sweet.   Great service too.
author: Jessica L.

description:
I'm sitting in the Union Street Coffee roastery as I speak because i'm determined to visit all the coffee shops in my neighborhood that I've  neglected in the 3 years I've been living in Cow Hollow. I had no idea they were an internet cafe which was a pleasant surprise because my computer is on the fritz and I'm both too lazy and too broke to get it fixed. Seven dollars for an hour of internet time? Eh, seems worth it I guess just to get my fix.

The food and coffee...is okay. They have a good pastry selection but the blueberry bran muffin I ordered was a little too crumbly and a tad bland. The cappuccino tastes a little burnt and is WAY too strong. I'm not hardcore people. I don't like 5 shots of expresso in one ounce of milk. My stomach can't handle that kind of stimulation!

If I come back it will be because I still haven't gotten my computer fixed and once again, need the internet; in which case i'll put up with the burnt coffee and mediocre muffins.
author: Julia N.

description:
I thought the coffee here was okay, but the service was bad enough to warrant one star. The two chicks working when I went there were so rushed getting people through the line (it was hardly busy) and barking orders at each other that they weren't really listening and got my drink and my friend's drink wrong. Upon pointing this out, they proceeded to argue with my friend instead of just fixing it.

Also, the bathroom was a total mess and clogged up. Handle it! 

If the two women working could slow down just a TINY bit and actually listen, this place could improve immensely!
author: Rose G.

description:
I came here once, but probably wouldn't go back to try them again. It was a cold and rainy day, so I wanted something warm and tastey for my drive back home.
I stepped in and there was only 1 other customer there and 3 employees. It didn't have much of a friendly atmosphere. It took a long time for an employee to acknowledge me.
They have all these lists of drinks up on the boards and lots of different coffee beans and stuff. Now I'm not a pro when it comes to knowing my coffee, but I'm ok like any normal person. They had a list of decafs up on the board too, so I just wanted one of those. But they said they don't have any of those on the board, that they don't sell them and they only have one regual decaf. Or at least this is what I got from her. I don't know, this confused me, and the girl who helped me did not look me in the eyes, mumbled a lot, did not take interest in me, and appeared to not want to acknowedge my existence.
I got just whatever she pointed to and left. My drink was ok; thus, I'm giving them 2 stars, but, I won't go here again.
author: Monica M.

description:
Like others have said, the baristas don't even pretend to be friendly. The wi-fi is $3.95 for a day's access, and pretty slow for it not being free. Their baked goods are not made on site, so quality is pretty shifty. You're better off walking down Fillmore to either Espresso Roma for wi-fi or Abigail's for pastries.

Sorry Coffee Roastery, you have absolutely nothing going for you.
author: Sandra S.

description:
This review is strictly for the frozen yogurt. I grew up with honey hill frozen yogurt and was excited to see that it's back. I had the Vanilla Bean with granola and the gf had the dark chocolate. Both were tasty and creamy and stayed firm until the very last bite. The vanilla bean even had real madagascar vanilla bits in it! The portions are huge - they fill half the cup with yogurt, then add  the topping, and then fill the cup with more yogurt. It's our go to spot when we don't want to serve ourselves tart froyo.

*nom nom*
author: Steve H.

description:
So, I just had a bad morning - like a really bad morning.  Like waking up at the ass crack of dawn to drive to San Rafael / San Quentin to drop off a car that was supposed to be covered under warranty.  But it's (apparently) not (still in question) and I almost get ripped off (yelp review for Park Royale Supercenter coming soon...) for 425$.  Granted that's not the point here.  The point is that I was in such a horrible mood on my way back to work that I realized I hadn't had any food, and man did I need some coffee.  

I come into the Roastery (I've never been b4) and 4 people smile at me and say 'good morning' in this really genuine way.  I melted.  Really.  Plus it smells great in there, and since I had used my 5$ in random-places-of-my-car change to get back across the GG, they accepted my credit card, which is really nice for a indie c-shop.  

The onion bagel I had was toasted perfectly and my sumatra coffee was fantastic.  Its a little out of my way, but I will definitely make it back.
author: Karen K.

description:
Just walking down Union Street, window shopping, freezing my booty off, i popped into this roastery since the smells wafting down the street were so alluring. Ahhh..warm toasty little coffee shop, freshly ground coffee and pastries!!

I ordered a medium low fat vanilla latte...and yes, it was warm, it was toasty, it kept the chills away on that brisk afternoon...but was it tasty? not so much.  It tasted burnt & bland. I even added vanilla powder into the coffee to add some flavoring and it didn't do much for it.  

boo. i guess there's always starbucks down the street...
author: Lulu C.

description: I came in on a Tuesday afternoon to purchase an iced espresso.  I observed the barista blowing his nose right before he made my drink.  I politely asked him to wash his hands with soap before making my drink as it is a health code violation to continue preparing food without doing so.  He grumbled something to himself and proceeded to wash his hands.  I don't think it should be the customer's responsibility to make sure the employees at Union Street Coffee Roastery hold themselves accountable to the health code. 1 star.
author: Ian F.

description: Ridiculously hot and tasteless coffee. The chai latte was undrinkable, both because it was blisteringly hot, but also because it was so spicy that it was overwhelming.
author: James H.

description: A lill pick me up for the days events and stopped by for some coffee. Overall, no after taste yuck, Yeah! Desserts not so great a little dry  especially their brownies.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Decent coffee, I had a hazelnut non-fat latte. The restroom was a gym locker. I had to rearrange all my stuff , including the key and the huge thing attached to it every time I had to do something different. Flush the toilet, pull the pants up, wash hands. Paper towels, door! You get the idea. The locals did seem to be enjoying their outside tables though.
  Staff was acknowledged me but I wouldn't say they go out of their way to be friendly.
author: Emily B.

description: A coffee shop of convenience.   There are plenty of options for coffee and supporting your local roaster always sounds appealing but the only thing worth paying for here is the house coffee.  The staff is very friendly and helpful but the barista(s) are lacking and I wouldn't recommend ordering anything that requires the espresso machine.  I do find myself returning often because I work across the street and the convenience tips the scale in their favor.  If you're in a rush, go for it.  If you have a little time on your hands, keep moving.
author: Jarica S.

description: Walk of Shame got you down? Party a little too long in the Marina or Union Street last night? Maybe you made your parents proud and stayed with a "friend" after one too many? Then look no farther (if you are not still seeing double) for this little life saver. Its even got a bus stop in front.
author: Justin C.

description:
Vanilla latte with non fat milk please- YUM.
I love this place, its at the perfect spot at the bottom of the hill and there is always a table waiting for me.
I used to think it was much bigger because of the wall mirror- yes, I was the dumbass...
author: Janell D.

description:
While the Marina district ranks up there with McDonald's on the authenticity and quality scale for me, I was walking through and this place caught my eye. Oops.

The baristas on staff claimed to not be coffee drinkers. That alone should have convinced me to leave without ordering. Sadly I didn't listen to my instincts.

The Cafe Vienna I purchased here was more bitter and burnt tasting than completely black coffee available at any of the other respectable coffee establishments in the city (such as Blue Bottle or Philz Coffee).

I can only recommend buying coffee here if you have no alternative, and even then I do so with a heavy heart.
author: Philip W.

description:
From my one customer experience, the place looks cool with lots of roasting machinery, beans by the pound, and lots of indoor and outdoor (cool benches) seating.

Maybe it was a bad batch, considering all the high scores from other yelpers.

But my cup of coffee was thick as mud and burnt.  It was like drinking the bottom scraps of a toaster oven.

Maybe I'm just a Starbux whore.  Hey, Bux might not be great coffee, but at least it's consistent.
author: Isaac L.

description: I got a basic coffee here, and it was disgusting. It was the worst tasting coffee I've had in San Francisco. I had to toss it even after loading it with half and half and sugar. The creamer bar also did not stock Splenda or Stevia -- which is kind of a basic sweetener these days. They only had Sweet n' Low and Equal. There were lots of tiny flies in the coffee shop. The light is a little too dim for reading.
author: Kimmie M.

description:
I have been coming to this coffee shop for years now. It has such a warm and inviting atmosphere that you won't get at a Starbuck's or Pete's Coffee. They make a delicious and strong expresso and their mocha is a favorite too. The employees always happily greet me and the place has nice seating. While I come here to enjoy a cup of coffee with friends, I often bring my laptop to work away here while enjoying their breakfast burritos in the morning. The bacon burritos are delicious! Lemon bars are divine too. 
I love this place and will continue coming back here.
author: Jenna C.

description: Nice and friendly staff, good coffee, cool location, fine pastries - should be visited!
author: Andrea K.

description:
I really wish the lattes were good because the staff is sooo nice here!  Unfortunately they are only marginally better than Espresso Roma down the street(which is TERRIBLE).  I have not tried the drip coffee but I've heard "burnt"
What IS good is the premade Ham and Cheese sandwich, and also the Ham and Cheese croissant.  
So pretty much go for Ham and Cheese, or if you're too lazy to walk anywhere else.  Or if you want someone to stand on the other side of a counter and be nice to you.
author: Flemm F.

description: This is a pleasant, run-of-the-mill coffee shop. I will gladly buy coffee here. I will not, however, ever use the restroom again. Seriously, guys...it's like a truck stop bathroom in Barstow, after a hurricane. Do something about it.
author: Autumn K.

description: On a recent shopping trip to Union Street, my friend and I discovered this place. It's a nice-sized coffee place and the smell of freshly ground coffee is heaven. I like coming here, to work on my writing and I live all the way in Russian Hill. The free wi-fi is great and the bus stop is right outside the door.
author: Jennifer C.

description: The roasted Colombian coffee beans I bought are great to make my coffee at home.  Displays etc felt a little disorganized and somehow the space was not inviting enough to consider going and hanging out with a cup.  There certainly were a lot of food choices but a tad overwhelming.
author: Ash A.

description:
OK so this is my first review.  It's not going to be pretty.  I work very close to here and need a few cups of tea to get me through my work day.  I'm a simple "english breakfast tea" person.  Thank you kind sir.

So I start going in every morning, and usually a few times during the day - over the course of about 5 months.  The same 2 or 3 people behind the counter - the same order (with the occasional bagel thrown in).  They never once acknowledge / recognize me - never, ever remember the "tea', complicated as it is.  But seriously, 2 visits a day, 5 days a week for about 5 months.  How hard would it be to act like you recognize me from a few hours ago.

I know it sounds petty - but I'd rather walk the extra 4 blocks and pay less for a larger cup at Starbucks where after 2 weeks, they recognize me and remember my order.   I know it's not Cheers - and really - if they were just a little friendlier in there who'd give a damn?  But they're all about grabbing the money and moving me along for the next customer.
author: Claire M.

description:
My machiato tasted burnt, so I had to "ask" for some soy milk to settle it a bit.

Nice breakfast pastry selections, love the oatcakes. Great staff, so friendly and greet every customer like their long time neighbors. 

My complaint is, I was there for 20 minutes this morning, my outfit smelled like....grease, or cooking smoke. I hate to smell like I've been cooking chinese food all day.
author: Yuchi C.

description:
Pretty good place.
There were 5 of us and all we wanted to do was have a coffee, chat, and maybe break out some board games. We had no problem finding a table and the atmosphere was laid back and good.
We split a lemon bar and the pumpkin cheesecake muffin, yum.
They didn't seem to care that we were in there for a long time, either.
And the coffee smelled really good, and tasted good too.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Great coffee and friendly service. I go here just about every day and I'm never disappointed. Plus you don't get the same pretentiousness that walks in and out of the Starbucks down the street.

There is also good people-watching available outside from one of the benches. So grab a latte and perfectly toasted bagel, sit down, relax and enjoy.
author: Dave L.

description:
LOUD! SO LOUD! Good coffee and stuff, but the roasting machine is REALLY LOUD!!!

Lesson learned: don't try to have a client meeting here...
author: Kim F.

description:
Lowfat, no foam vanilla latte and a ham and cheese croissant (heated of course) is my favorite weekend breakfast in the city.  

Cheap and delicious.  They are also genuinely appreciative to have you as a customer.

Their regular cup o' joe is better than Starbucks (weird aftertaste in my opinion at Starbucks).  Their vanilla latte is leaps and bounds better.  I know, it's just coffee, but it's got a lot of flavor and is creamy and well blended.  

$5 min on credit cards.
author: Rachel W.

description:
I like the white chocolate mocha with a shot of espresso.
Free wifi.
Cute girls working the counter the few times I've been there.

I can't ask for more.

Disclaimers: I've only been there a handful of times, and I'm not a coffee connoisseur.
author: Derek L.

description: I have been coming to Union Street Roastery on and off since 1999, even before I moved to the bay! Some of those visits not only included having the wonderful coffee and coffee drinks, along with the pastries, but whole beans to take back as well. This last time, I came in to have coffee after dinner with a friend, and we could attest to the distinct, focused coffee here (not just strong, but truly crafted, purposeful flavors). And for an iced drink, my friend's mocha certainly carried some really profound flavors. My house coffee was no exception to this either. I'm looking forward to another trip here, and perhaps another pound of whole beans may be considered, as well.
author: Ryan T.

description: i visited few days ago and i have say that I am very disappointed with their service,it's pretty poor,they shouldn't be in service business.
author: Mason C.

description: Stars are for the fro yo only - haven't tried anything else! The Honey Hills Farms fro yo was muy delicioso! I'm PSYCHED about this addition to the fro yo scene. Poor Michaelis has got nothing on this fro yo. My husband had a vanilla chocolate swirl with M&Ms. Very generous serving, and quality vanilla with vanilla bean specks. I had half blueberry and half peanut butter, a small was too big for me to finish! Couldn't decide which flavor I preferred, both were delicious. They tasted like real peanut butter and real blueberry, unlike powder mix frozen yogurts. Highly recommended! This will be going into the regular rotation!
author: Sarah R.

description: I get my coffee here when I'm waiting for the bus. They are quick and friendly and my latte is always perfect. Try the 7 layer bar...yummy!
author: Lane B.

description: Yucky burnt espresso under thin milky cappuccino. Couldn't even drink, waste of $3.25. I should have yelped first, I am sure there is better coffee to be had nearby.
author: L J.

description:
I stopped by the Union Street Coffee Roastery this morning while walking with my wife and son and picked up a latte and a chocolate croissant. 

The latte was perfectly mixed, right up to a nice swirl of frothy foam on top. The coffee in it was well roasted and very flavorful. The croissant was great, though would have been better warmed (I was in a rush and did not ask if they had the ability to heat it). 

The most appealing part of the experience was the service. The cashier who took my order was relaxed, friendly, and engaging. While I was waiting for my drink, it became clear that he knew most of the customers coming in by name, and not because (as with Starbucks) it was policy to do so. 

Here's to true, independent coffee houses!
author: J. M.

description: I. am. really. fucking. picky.  Pretty much about everything: what I eat, who I date, when I answer the phone, whose email I respond to and when, etc.  So, 5 stars doesn't seem enough for how fanfuckingtastic this coffee is.  I can no longer tollerate starbucks...ew.  I want coffee roastery!  And you know what else kids?  The people that work here are nice and friendly, not scowling at you like starbucks employees.  I understand why they are bitter, but you have to put on your game face at work, seriously.  Further, I have never seen that smelly homeless person trying to set up camp here, which makes my little black heart sigh with relief.  YAY!!! Drugs!
author: Jess S.

description: They've got a bean roasting contraption in this place which makes it interesting. Lots of fresh coffee bean bins, but I don't really drink coffee so I don't really care.  My almond vanilla tea was good though.  I had a slice of quiche lorraine up in this place with an apricot bar.  The quiche was too crumbly, had too many onions and was salty.  What saves this place is that the apricot bar was exquisite.  I absolutely love apricot bars, and by absolutely, I mean I will choose an awesome apricot bar over almost any other dessert treat.  If it weren't for the bar, this place gets two stars.
author: Rick H.

description:
Recipe for a Monday Morning

Ingredients:

* 1 ripe Muni bus (I recommend the 43)
* 67 middle school kids
* The song "Swimmers" by Broken Social Scene
* 1 half-decaf, half-regular coffee from USCR
* The Internet
* Optional: Rain

Preparation:

Wake to alarm at 6:00 with full intention of getting to work early. Contemplate calling in sick. Contemplate possibility of wandering the Asian subcontinent for six months. Contemplate possibility of time travel. Rise at 7:15. Take 32-minute shower. Iron clothes, dress, depart. Watch bus pass by while walking to bus stop. RUN to catch bus at next stop. ACTUALLY MAKE IT. Stand in stairwell because bus is burdened with load of 67 middle school students. Place headphones on head. Listen to "Swimmers." Get a seat, finally. Listen to "Swimmers" 11 more times. Exit bus, enter work. Check email, check email #2, check Digg. Check Yelp. Check SFist, Upcoming and NY Times. Check Yelp again. Wander downstairs for coffee. Say hello to Rolando and Co. Consider ordering, then not ordering, then ordering croissant. Walk back upstairs with coffee and croissant. Stare out window toward bay while sipping coffee. Consider moving, starting a family, and recycling more. Consider threat of avian influenza. Check Digg. Check Yelp.
author: Shaun E.

description: There are two things I get here and will walk the 13 blocks to obtain them. Black coffee, and the APRICOT BAR!!!! I'm trying to convince my TenderNob friend to try it, but he won't make the venture. If he knew what he was missing, he'd make the trip. I suggest you do too. AND THEY ACCEPT CREDIT CARDS!
author: Matheson J.

description: I really wish this place was better since I work a block away at the asscrack of dawn. 2 stars for the pastries and such...the bagles are always good as are the scones. 1 star for the hot chocolate. I gave up on their regular coffee because the one time I had it, it was bitter and just not good. What also sucks is that sometimes their drinks are luke warm such as today...when you don't have a microwave, that blows!
author: Nikki O.

description: Went there once.  Got a cup of coffee.  Tasted it. It tasted like lukewarm water with brown food coloring.  Threw it away about a minute after leaving the cafe.  Haven't gone back since.
author: Nilu r.

description: I've been to this  place a couple times, simply to order beans. Both times, they refused to let me smell or taste a single bean from the barrels. They have like 20 types, how else would you decide? I'm not going to order 10 cups of espresso to taste the beans, I'd be so jacked up I'd bug right out of the store! None of the people working there could tell me anything about the types either! I don't think they drink coffee. I needed beans and didn't want to waste time shopping around, so I bought half a pound of espresso roast and another half of caffe vienna (both whole beans). Both were great beans. The vienna was dark and smokey, which I like for french press or drip. The espresso roast had depth, slight sweetness and full flavor. Both types were very fresh. The service was bad though, not friendly at all. If their beans weren't good, I wouldn't have returned a second time. I'm constantly in search of good places to find beans though, so I probably won't return once I find a favorite spot.
author: Adam F.

description: Not surprised this place only has 3 stars! The lady microwaved my burrito still in the non microwave friendly wrapper ( sticker and all). The burrito is supposedly made organically according to her yet she put it in the microwave with the wrapper which is a carcinogen that has absurd into my burrito?! Then I asked if there was a restroom key and she said the restroom was broken. A few minutes later she used it. Then she started cleaning with heavy duty cleanser behind the counter, the smell was so overwhelming I just left.In all fairness I have to say the gentleman tgat worked here today was very polite and accimidating. He gave me utensils and brought over a plate. I noted tgat he brought all the customers orders to them where as the woman bagged all orders to go (without asking the customers) and called it out and left it to be picked up at the counter.
author: Joan M.

description: It's truly the people that make coffee roastery my favorite...I don't go anywhere else because the baristas brighten my every morning.  They know me by name, converse with me, and start making my order right when I walk in the door.  Becoming a regular here has really made this place the BEST for me.  The pumpkin muffins are the best.  Thanks guys....you make my mornings!
author: Chris P.

description: Rockin latte guys, a dark, stiff roast, heavy foam, and hott. Just like I like it. $3.
author: Jeremi M.

description: Local business, good coffee, friendly & speedy service, right by the bus stop...what more could you ask for?
author: Casey B.

description: Potent coffee. I must have added half a cup of milk to dilute it! I tried a slice of pumpkin pie, which had a strange aftertaste. It was fresh tasting, but something about the spices in it was odd, as well as the texture. The place itself is a cozy, comfy, and casual place where you can hang out and people watch..
author: Michele O.

description: The roastery has changed my perspective on the simple cup of coffee.  I used to think I had to get a latte or a mocha to fulfill my coffee cravings on the weekend.  Then I tried the roastery and now love just the regular old cup of coffee!  Not to mention their ham and cheese croissants.  And the service is always great...everyone is friendly and cheerful.  I can't seem to go to any other coffee shop anymore!
author: Jen S.

description: Also went there once, the coffee taste burnt, threw it out after a few sips, or maybe it was just too strong but me thinks it was burned. Over roasted coffee is just as bad as eating burned food.
author: Petra M.

description: I must admit, I am hesitant to post this review because I like the fact the the Roastery never gets very crowded. The service is excellent and very friendly. The coffee is not bad - it can be a little inconsistent, but overall it's good.
author: Scott W.

description: Really nice people, decent pastries, but the lattes taste burnt.  Whenever I go (out of convenience) I end up disappointed with that day's daily caffeine injection.
author: Holly M.

description: Amazingly badly pulled cappuccino - both too acidic and too weak. It's a shame because the location is nice.
author: Shayna K.

description: The local coffee alternative to starbucks with attention to customer service and quality.  Always a pleasure to go there.  The Columbian Supremo is my bean of choice.
author: Eric M.

description: Love this place. I am a hugh fan of their mocha's especially if they are done by a certain barista in the early morning....(no names mention). Overall, the place has great service and are very kind.
author: Unique t.

description: My friend and I stopped here for an evening coffee after hopping around the city.  My iced mocha was pretty good.  A little on the bitter side, but thats not always a bad thing.  The service was decent.  The bathroom situation is a little sketchy , like previously mentioned.  I took a look around the closet toilet room and decided to wait it out.
author: MJ R.

description: I'm not sure what i think of the staff...can't decide if they are just shy or what, but I do find them pleasant.. The latte's are good, and the service is really fast!  They allow dogs to come in, which is a big plus in my book.
author: JD D.

description: comfortable looking place, good location on Union Street if you want to take a break from shopping for way overpriced stuff you dont need in stores filled with plastique people and bewildered tourists...coffee average, you can make better at home (but you gotta get the right beans and grind em yourself!), pastries tasted one or two days old and likely not that great to begin with...though the plum cake did look yummy...just didnt taste yummy...overall, not really worth the bother.
author: Tom B.

description: I ordered the over priced large coffee (not even good coffee) and a pecan chew (is awesome) for $4.00 and was told that I couldn't use my debit card unless I purchased $5.00.  New policy this week and bad business. The cost of the ingredients is about $1.00. I ask them if they were turning down my business and they said yes. New rule per the Owner.   I walked up the street to  Starbucks who gladly took my card.   Don't expect to see them in business for much longer. Every sale counts.
author: chris J.
